direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods handle the addition of attributes with similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods modify the attribute set, but one adds while the other removes attributes.
Both methods set attributes, but putIgnoreCase is case-insensitive, which can be tested similarly with case-sensitive scenarios.
put(Attribute) relies on the put(String, String) method to set the attribute, making it a dependent method.
Both methods manipulate internal data structures, though userData handles a different type of data.
Both methods handle attribute keys and may need to manage cases where attributes do not exist.
The html method relies on the attributes set by put, making it a dependent method.
